title: Creating a reading list on endangered languages and low-resource language documentation and revitalization is a great way to explore the challenges and strategies in this field
note: Here are 20 articles and resources up to 2020 that you might find useful:

title: **"Language Documentation and Description"**
collection-title: This series of volumes provides comprehensive insights into language documentation practices

title: **"The Cambridge Handbook of Endangered Languages"**
This handbook offers a broad overview of the issues surrounding language endangerment and revitalization
**"Documenting and Revitalizing Austronesian Languages"**
This collection focuses on the Austronesian language family and includes case studies and methodologies
This book discusses the causes and consequences of language extinction and offers strategies for revitalization
**"Endangered Languages: An Introduction"** - By Sarah G. Thomason. This book provides an accessible introduction to the topic of language endangerment
**"Revitalizing Indigenous Languages"**
collection-title: This collection of essays discusses various strategies for language revitalization

title: **"Language Documentation: What is it and what is it good for?"**
This article outlines the goals and methods of language documentation
**"The Role of New Technologies in Preserving and Revitalizing Indigenous Languages"** - By Keren Rice. This article explores how technology can aid in language preservation efforts
**"Language Revitalization Processes and Prospects: Quichua in the Ecuadorian Andes"**
This article examines the revitalization efforts of the Quichua language
**"The Green Book of Language Revitalization in Practice"**
container-title: This book provides practical examples of language revitalization efforts

title: **"Endangered Languages and Linguistic Rights: A Sociolinguistic Perspective"** - By Tove Skutnabb-Kangas. This article discusses the intersection of language rights and language endangerment
**"Language Documentation and Conservation"** - A journal that publishes articles on the documentation and conservation of endangered languages
A documentary film that follows linguists as they document endangered languages. While not an article, it provides valuable insights into the fieldwork aspect of language documentation
**"Language Revitalization and Language Pedagogy: New Teaching and Learning Strategies"** - By Leanne Hinton. This article discusses innovative approaches to teaching endangered languages
**"The Impact of Globalization on Language Vitality"** - By Suzanne Romaine. This article examines how globalization affects language endangerment

author.literal: **"Language Endangerment and Language Revitalization"** - By Tasaku Tsunoda.

title: This book provides a detailed analysis of the factors leading to language endangerment and the efforts to counteract it
**"Revitalizing Indigenous Languages through Education"**
This article explores the role of education in language revitalization
**"The Role of Communities in Language Documentation and Revitalization"** - By Colette Grinevald. This article emphasizes the importance of community involvement in language preservation efforts
**"Language Documentation and Revitalization in the Andes and Mesoamerica"**
container-title: This book focuses on language preservation efforts in specific regions

author.literal: **"The Ethics of Language Documentation and Revitalization"** - By Peter K. Austin.

title: This article discusses the ethical considerations involved in working with endangered languages
These resources should provide a solid foundation for understanding the complexities and methodologies involved in documenting and revitalizing endangered and low-resource languages
